article.headline: VCU 73, Drexel 54
article.story: RICHMOND, Va. -- Larry Sanders notched a double-double, scoring 29 points and grabbing 13 rebounds, as Virginia Commonwealth topped Drexel 73-54 on Tuesday night. Bradford Burgess also recorded a double-double, adding 11 points and 10 rebounds for the Rams (18-7, 10-6 Colonial Athletic Association). Sanders also had five blocks and two steals. Sanders scored eight straight points midway through the first half as VCU went on a 17-4 run and held Drexel scoreless for 6:13, helping the Rams to a 33-21 halftime edge. Sanders finished with 12 points -- hitting 5 of 6 field goals -- and added five rebounds and three blocks in the half. The Rams continued their domination with an 8-2 start to the second half, capped by Brandon Rozzell's 3-pointer. The Dragons never got closer than 13 the rest of the way. Jamie Harris led the Dragons (15-13, 10-6) with 20 points and Shannon Givens added 12.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
